AV Updates.-1: Wrong parameters passed to the function
AV Updates.-1004: Could not connect to proxy or server
AV Updates.-1005: Could not authenticate to proxy or server
AV Updates.-1009: Write error (could not write to local file or WriteFn returned error)
AV Updates.-1014: Callback function HeaderFn, WriteFn or ReadFn returned error
AV Updates.-1020: Returned after a stop call on that service
AV Updates.-1021: Retry downloading file for UpdateV1 service
AV Updates.-1022: The server response is not valid
AV Updates.-2001: Could not verify versions.dat file with versions.sig
AV Updates.-2003: No files were marked to be installed
AV Updates.-2004: Installation has failed (maybe because files could not be overwritten)
AV Updates.-2005: Installation has skipped the file (returned from WSLibUpdateV1CallbackFn)
AV Updates.-2006: Authorization code doesn't match serial (different key ids)
AV Updates.-2013: File must not be downloaded and updated
AV Updates.-2008: Could not verify versions.dat file signature from versions.id
AV Updates.-2010: No files were marked to be installed
AV Updates.-2011: Installation has failed (maybe because files could not be overwritten)
AV Updates.-2012: Installation has skipped the file (returned from WSLibUpdateV1CallbackFn)
AV Updates.-2014: File must not be downloaded and updated
AV Updates.-2015: No location provided or location name does not match with the one in the .xml file

AV Install.1327: The installer was run under safe mode.
AV Install.1314: The installer was run under an user with insufficient privileges.
AV Install.1633: Installer.exe is not compliant with the operating system architecture
AV Install.1003: The product configuration JSON could not be run at the end of the installation
AV Install.1168: Installer cannot load one of its configuration files (install_config.xml, install_x86.xml/install_x64.xml) or cannot find additional.dll
AV Install.3017: A restart action is pending as a result of another maintenance (install, repair, modify, uninstall) operation that required restart in order to finish correctly. The error code indicates that the current maintenance operation cannot continue until restart is performed. Another case when this code is returned is when the repair or uninstall fails and will try again after a reboot.
AV Install.1151: Unsupported operating system. The list of supported operated systems can be found at system requirements
AV Install.1613: Wrong Windows Installer version installed on the machine.
AV Install.112: There isn't enough space on the disk for the product to be installed
AV Install.183: "Installer.exe is already running. Or, in case installer runs silent without "/modify", "/repair" or "/remove" command line parameter specified on a machine where the product has already been installed. This code is also returned when an older version of the product is run over a newer version."
AV Install.87: The installer was started with an invalid command line or no feature was selected to be installed. Valid installer command line arguments are defined in  Installer parameters   section. //Did not download the files for BEST
AV Install.1027: The installer was unable to remove previously existing LogMeIn AV or BitDefender services. Check services.msc for any previously existing LogMeIn AV or BitDefender EP entries and delete them from an admin command prompt using SC DELETE [SERVICE NAME]
AV Install.5: Generic failure. Try removing temp files & leftover services from cmd or the registry. You may need to boot into safemode to remove some leftover services.

LogMeIn.LoadUrl: Usually for an update, where the update is from
LogMeIn.Session: When in a session, not necessarily remote control
LogMeIn.Socket: IP/port of connections. Sometimes contains Windows errors
LogMeIn.Logger: Logging for the LMI Control Panel
LogMeIn.FeatureTracker: SendRCStats (hard to tell, maybe for BICloud?)
LogMeIn.RenderLockBackgroundImage: Process that shows background on login page
LogMeIn.LockScreenBackground: Getting the background image for rendering
LogMeIn.DriveMapper: Mapped drives (from Client to host) or network drives?
LogMeIn.Main: The bulk of the program. Contains misc. information
LogMeIn.RemotelyAnywhere: Old, but still shows for proxy info
LogMeIn.Startup: Starting a remote connection processes. Indicates session start.
LogMeIn.LMIKeyboard: Unknown: Virtual keyboard? allows for keyboard locking while still allowing input?
LogMeIn.Remote Control: Remote control session and its processes
LogMeIn.OnTheFly: Screen blanking packets (settings changed during connection)
LogMeIn.RC.IPC: Unknown: possibly the connection test for packet loss?
LogMeIn.Kaspersky: KES and possibly KSU as well
LogMeIn.CredCheck: Unknown: Credential check, unclear what for (O2M?)
LogMeIn.CPerfMeterDrv: Unknown: Finds the drive the perfmon should watch?
LogMeIn.IPCStream Server: indicates that the AV Management client process exited and the communication channel is closed
LogMeIn.VPX: Video library used for displaying remote screen
LogMeIn.SessionDataReport: Gives JSON formatted information regarding latency and IP information.
